ingredients: 8 thick slices 2-day-old bread (better if slightly stale)
method: In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and cinnamon. Stir in the orange zest and/or triple sec if using. Whisk the mixture until well blended and pour into a shallow bowl, wide enough to place a slice of the bread you will be using.
Place each slice of bread into the milk-egg mixture, allowing the bread to soak in some of it.

Melt some butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Shake off the excess egg mixture from the bread and place the bread slices onto the skillet. Brown on one side, then flip and brown the other side.
recipes.serve: Serve the French toast hot with butter, maple syrup, and/or fresh berries.

method: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.
recipes.serve: Serve the pancakes warm with butter, maple syrup, and fresh fruit if desired.

method: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until soft.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Serve the sauce over the cooked spaghetti.
recipes.serve: Top with grated Parmesan cheese and serve hot.

ingredients: 1 large head of romaine lettuce, chopped
method: In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, croutons, and grated Parmesan cheese.
Add grilled chicken slices on top.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and toss until evenly coated.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
recipes.serve: Serve immediately with extra Parmesan cheese if desired.

method: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until soft.
Add diced carrot, bell pepper, and peas. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Push the vegetables to the side of the pan and pour in the beaten eggs. Scramble until fully cooked.
Add the cooked rice, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Stir-fry until everything is well combined and heated through.
Garnish with chopped green onions if desired.
recipes.serve: Serve hot as a main dish or side.

method: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Arrange mozzarella slices on top of the sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and drizzle with olive oil.
recipes.serve: Season with salt and pepper before serving hot.

method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan.
In a large bowl, mix together the melted butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla.
Stir in cocoa powder, flour, salt, and baking powder until well combined.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
recipes.serve: Let cool before cutting into squares. Serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream if desired.

ingredients: 2 cups semisweet and/or milk chocolate chips
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour and baking soda. Set aside.
In a separate bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add salt, vanilla, and eggs. Mix until combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture, then stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop tablespoon-sized balls of dough onto the prepared baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
Cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
recipes.serve: Enjoy warm with a glass of milk.

ingredients: Optional toppings: cherry tomatoes, poached egg, red pepper flakes, feta cheese
method: Toast the bread slices to your desired level of crispness.
In a small bowl, mash the avocado with a fork. Stir in salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toasted bread.
Add optional toppings like cherry tomatoes, a poached egg, red pepper flakes, or feta cheese.
Breakfast.serve: Serve immediately as a healthy and filling breakfast.

ingredients: Toppings: granola, sliced fruit, chia seeds, nuts, honey
method: In a blender, combine the frozen banana, frozen berries, Greek yogurt, and milk or juice. Blend until smooth.
Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
Top with granola, sliced fruit, chia seeds, nuts, and a drizzle of honey.
Breakfast.serve: Enjoy immediately for a refreshing breakfast.

ingredients: 1/4 cup diced vegetables (bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, etc.)
Optional fillings: diced ham, bacon, spinach, etc.
method: In a bowl, whisk the eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Heat butter or oil in a skillet over medium heat. Pour in the egg mixture.
As the eggs set, gently pull the edges toward the center, letting uncooked egg flow to the edges.
Once the eggs are almost set, sprinkle cheese and fillings over one half of the omelette.
Fold the omelette in half and cook for another minute, then slide onto a plate.
Breakfast.serve: Serve hot with toast or fresh fruit.

method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, breadcrumbs, milk, Parmesan cheese, onion, garlic, egg, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Form the mixture into a loaf shape and place it in a baking dish.
Wrap the loaf with bacon slices, overlapping slightly. Spread ketchup on top.
Bake for 1 hour or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F (70°C).
dinner.serve: Serve the bacon-wrapped meatloaf with mashed potatoes and gravy.

method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add taco seasoning and water to the beef. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Spread tortilla chips on a large baking sheet. Top with seasoned beef and shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake in the oven for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from oven and top with sour cream, jalapeños, tomatoes, green onions, black olives, and guacamole.
dinner.serve: Serve the loaded nachos immediately with your favorite dipping sauces.

ingredients: 2 cups leftover macaroni and cheese, chilled
method: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
Scoop chilled macaroni and cheese into balls and place on a baking sheet.
Coat each ball in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, and roll in a mixture of breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Fry the balls in hot oil until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
dinner.serve: Serve the deep-fried mac and cheese balls hot with ranch dressing for dipping.

method: Preheat grill or stover pan over medium-high heat.
Divide ground beef into 8 equal portions and form into patties. Season with salt and pepper.
Grill patties for 4-5 minutes per side or until desired doneness.
During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheddar and a slice of American cheese on 4 of the patties. Stack the other patties on top to form double burgers.
Toast burger buns on the grill until golden brown.
Assemble the burgers with mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and bacon.
dinner.serve: Serve the double cheeseburgers with fries and a cold soda.

method: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface and place on a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread Alfredo sauce evenly over the dough.
Top with shredded chicken, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, bacon, and green onions.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
dinner.serve: Serve the chicken Alfredo pizza hot with a side of garlic bread.

method: Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, and grill over medium heat until fully cooked. Let cool and slice.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion.
Top with grilled chicken slices and sprinkle with feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
lunch.serve: Serve the grilled chicken salad immediately with your favorite bread or on its own.

method: Cook quinoa in water according to package instructions. Set aside.
In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add bell pepper, zucchini, and broccoli to the pan. Stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Add cooked quinoa, soy sauce, and sesame oil to the vegetables. Stir to combine and heat through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
lunch.serve: Serve the quinoa and vegetable stir-fry hot, garnished with sesame seeds if desired.

method: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until soft.
Add diced tomatoes and vegetable broth to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in fresh basil and season with salt and pepper.
If using, add heavy cream and heat through.
lunch.serve: Serve the tomato basil soup hot with a side of crusty bread.

method: Cut the pita pockets in half and spread hummus inside each pocket.
Fill each pita half with cucumber, tomato, red onion, shredded carrots, and crumbled feta cheese.
Drizzle tzatziki sauce over the vegetables.
lunch.serve: Serve the veggie pita sandwiches immediately with a side of fresh fruit or salad.

method: Spread mayonnaise and Dijon mustard evenly over each tortilla.
Layer turkey slices, avocado, lettuce, and cheddar cheese on each tortilla.
Roll up the tortillas tightly, securing with toothpicks if necessary.
Cut the wraps in half.
lunch.serve: Serve the turkey and avocado wraps with a side of fresh fruit or chips.
